page.title: 20Staffs & Worcs Canal
page.content: The Staff & Worcs Canal runs through the centre of the area in a North-South direction. It is no longer used for transport of bulky loads but is only used now for recreation. Pleasure boats and canal narrow boats which have been converted into floating holiday homes travel up and down it. Often they tie up near the pumping station at Dimmingsdale Bridge. Water from the canal feeds the two pools used for fishing by private owners. Of course the canal itself is used by anglers who are not members of the angling club or do not wish to pay a fee other than the annual water board.
